SUMMARY: EnvR, also known as AcrS, represses transcription of genes encoding a drug efflux pump that has a role in resistance to antibiotics [18567659]. This protein is homologous to some or proteins, such as MtrR of Neisseria gonorrhoeae, TcmR of Streptomyces glaucescens, JadR2 from Streptomyces venezuelae, and AcrR from Escherichia coli [7592375, 8196548]. All of se proteins, including EnvR, have a helix-turn-helix motif close to N terminus [7592375, 8196548]. EnvR recognizes and binds a 24-bp palindromic DNA sequence [18567659]. same sequence is also recognized by transcriptional repressor AcrR [18567659]. envR is adjacent and divergent in genome to acrEF, an operon that encodes anor drug efflux pump; however, it is not regulated or is only lightly affected by EnvR [18567659]. Both of se transcription units appears to be repressed by HNS [18567659].
